data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you face forward, you can't take 10 steps backward. The final answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take right 4 steps to turn around. Take 4 steps to turn right. The answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The shortest sequence is The shortest sequence is 6 steps. The second shortest sequence is 4 steps. The second shortest sequence is 10 steps. The first sequence is 4 steps. Turn around makes the shortest sequence. The shortest is 4. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step in that sequence was to take 1 step to turn left. Again, turning left requires a new sequence of steps, the first of which is turning right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and backwards. All the turns in 1 sequence return us to where we start. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot turn left and right at the same time. Turn around in half so that you are on the other side of the street. You turn around once to be on the other side of the street. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only need to do one of the two steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One of the steps is to turn around and take two steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’ t return to the starting point by going in any direction except left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 2 steps first. It takes you three steps to return back to the starting point. Taking 3 steps would get you back 3 feet. Taking 9 steps would get you back 9. Taking 2 steps would get you back 2 feet. Taking 7 steps would get you back 7 feet. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the very center of the circle. If you took 6 steps backward, you were also taken back to the right direction. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In this method, you are always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point in one of the following ways. The first step is right. There are three steps in one direction. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the same as the starting point. Just taken this way you would take 6 steps left and immediately take 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and go right. If you turn left, go left. If you turn left, the same direction is repeat from your starting point. If you turn right, the same direction is repeat from your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 steps back. It’s still a bit awkward because you’re looking back and you’re already behind. The explanation follows this pattern: Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps back. The contradiction is that you should turn around and take 3 steps back. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you make a turn after turning around, you’ll go right. If you don’t turn around right after turning right, you will go to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and walk 2 steps to the place where you left and take 9 steps back to start. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right in one direction. If you turn right, you will take 7 steps. If you turn right for a while, you will take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps to return to starting point. Take 3 steps to turn to the right. Take 6 steps to return to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you take 5 steps and take 3 steps, you get back to the starting point. Turning around takes 2 steps. With a 2 step turn you can get 10 more steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps and go one step back. Take 7 steps and go one step back. Take 10 steps and go one step forward and turn around. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Place your hands on top of your head. Face forward (not away from you). Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward when you walk. You take 7 steps backward when you walk. You take 9 steps left when you walk. So, the answer is Yes.

You should turn around and take 4 steps when you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point without taking some steps. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A turn around is the opposite of an inversion. Turning around after taking 5 steps does not mean you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting condition would be to always face forward. The second set of instructions would be to start face forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In taking 1 step, your action remains in 1 step. As you move backwards, you will take 10 steps, so you take a total of 10 steps. You can also take 4 steps, which is a total of 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions give a number of steps that you should take to turn around. Turning around is the number of steps that are needed to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps backward to return to the starting point. 6 steps right to come forward. 8 steps back to come backward. 8 steps right to come forward. So, the answer is Yes.

In the first example, 7 steps are taken to return to the starting point. In the second example, 8 steps are taken to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You should always look up to get back in the forward motion. You can not go backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you face forward, you take 5 steps left. If you take 1 step back, you take 4 steps right. When you take 1 step backward, you take 2 steps right. If you take 1 step backward, you take 4 steps right. If you take 2 steps right, you take 5 steps right. Doing the directions correctly return you to the starting place. Thus, the answer is Yes.

All steps backward must come to back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

To get to the starting point, take 5 steps from the left. The second step away from the starting point gives you the opportunity to take 4 steps away. A set of 3 steps backwards returns to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

It is always to take 5 steps in order for you to proceed to the starting point. If you take 5 steps, you inevitably will be walking back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

In descending order from the top, go 6 steps backward. In descending order from the top, go 4 steps backward. In descending order from the top, go 3 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions tell you to always face forward. In the beginning you always face upwards. One last thought: When you take two steps backwards, you are essentially taking 2 steps backwards, right? So, the answer is Yes.

Take 10 steps. Turn and run around. Then turn around and run. Then turn right and run. Then then turn left. Then turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

You always face forward if you' re doing this. If you take 7 steps left and 8 steps right, you' re going backward. Just because you’ re going backward, doesn' t mean that you' re going into the starting block. So, the answer is it is not possible to tell.

To start, take 1 step forward. If you follow the instructions, you start facing forward in the correct direction. If you start facing backward in the correct direction, you start facing backward in the starting direction. So, the answer is No.

You’ re going backwards by taking 6 steps right. If you start from where you are, you always return to same location. Just because you’ re going backward doesn’ t mean you return to starting point. So, the answer is no.

When you take 9 steps to the right of the starting point, it makes sense to take 9 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The first six steps are to your right. The next five steps are to your left. Then the next eight steps are to your right. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point can be returned to facing forward. If you always face forward, you can get to wherever you like. So, the answer is yes.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let' s think for a minute here. The number of steps in the first set of instructions is 10. The time required for "To Return to the Starting position" is 10 mins. You can subtract 7 or 8 from this total by using the factor of 10 = 1 or by multiplying by 1000 = 10x10 = 100. So in total there is 10 steps that are required to get to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is Yes.
